responses.alreadyQueued:
<@${user.id}> you are already in the queue. 
If you want to leave the queue you can cancel anytime with */cancel*.
responses.enqueue: `<@${user.id}> I added you to the queue. You can leave whenever you like by typing */cancel*`

responses.notInQueue:
<@${userId}> you are currently not in the queue. 
 You are able to join the queue by typing */qme*.
responses.removedUser: <@${userId}> I removed you from the queue. You can join again by typing */qme*

responses.noAdmin: Sorry <@${userId}> but I can't give you that Info. Check with someone who can grant you the **Bot Admin** Role.
responses.queueEmpty: Currently there's no one in the queue <@${userId}>. I can get back to you if someone enters, simply type */listen*
responses.nextUp: The next user in the queue is <@${nextUser.id}>. You can put him back into the queue with */putback*.

responses.enqueueFirst:
<@${userId}> the queue is empty right now. 
 That's you'r chance be the first and join the queue with */qme*.
responses.notInLine: <@${userId}> you are currently not in line. If you want to join the queue you can by typing */qme*
responses.nextUpt: <@${userId}> you are next up in the queue! ;)

responses.stopListen: Okay <@${userId}>, but keep in mind that the next members who enqueue will be unnotice. You can always give me a signal with */listen* to start informing you.
responses.startListen: I'll let you know if someone enqueues <@${userId}>. If you don't want me to to give you a hint you can type */listen stop*.
responses.alreadyListen: I already noted, that you want hints about the members which enqueued. Don't worry <@${userId}> I'll keep you up to date!

responses.generalHelp:
<@${userId}> you can use the following commands to chat with me: **qme, cancel, list, dequeue, configure, help**.

 If you want more information about a specific command just type */help <name of the command>*.
